001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of
003// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.
004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.math.filter.Debouncer;
010import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.BooleanEvent;
011import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
012import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
013import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;
014import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.InstantCommand;
015import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem;
016import java.util.function.BiFunction;
017import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
018
019/**
020 * This class is a wrapper around {@link BooleanEvent}, providing an easy way to link commands to
021 * digital inputs.
022 *
023 * <p>This class is provided by the NewCommands VendorDep
024 */
025public class Trigger extends BooleanEvent {
026  /**
027   * Creates a new trigger with the given condition/digital signal.
028   *
029   * @param loop the loop that polls this trigger
030   * @param signal the digital signal represented.
031   */
032  public Trigger(EventLoop loop, BooleanSupplier signal) {
033    super(loop, signal);
034  }
035
036  /**
037   * Copies the BooleanEvent into a Trigger object.
038   *
039   * @param toCast the BooleanEvent
040   * @return a Trigger wrapping the given BooleanEvent
041   * @see BooleanEvent#castTo(BiFunction)
042   */
043  public static Trigger cast(BooleanEvent toCast) {
044    return toCast.castTo(Trigger::new);
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Creates a new trigger with the given condition/digital signal.
049   *
050   * <p>Polled by the {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
051   *
052   * @param signal the digital signal represented.
053   */
054  public Trigger(BooleanSupplier signal) {
055    this(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop(), signal);
056  }
057
058  /** Creates a new trigger that is always inactive. */
059  @Deprecated
060  public Trigger() {
061    this(() -> false);
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Returns whether or not the trigger is active.
066   *
067   * <p>This method will be called repeatedly a command is linked to the Trigger.
068   *
069   * <p>Functionally identical to {@link Trigger#getAsBoolean()}.
070   *
071   * @return whether or not the trigger condition is active.
072   * @deprecated use {@link #getAsBoolean()}
073   */
074  @Deprecated
075  public final boolean get() {
076    return getAsBoolean();
077  }
078
079  /**
080   * Starts the given command whenever the trigger just becomes active.
081   *
082   * @param command the command to start
083   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
084   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
085   */
086  public Trigger whenActive(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
087    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "whenActive");
088
089    this.rising().ifHigh(() -> command.schedule(interruptible));
090    return this;
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Starts the given command whenever the trigger just becomes active. The command is set to be
095   * interruptible.
096   *
097   * @param command the command to start
098   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
099   */
100  public Trigger whenActive(final Command command) {
101    return whenActive(command, true);
102  }
103
104  /**
105   * Runs the given runnable whenever the trigger just becomes active.
106   *
107   * @param toRun the runnable to run
108   * @param requirements the required subsystems
109   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
110   */
111  public Trigger whenActive(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
112    return whenActive(new InstantCommand(toRun, requirements));
113  }
114
115  /**
116   * Constantly starts the given command while the button is held.
117   *
118   * <p>{@link Command#schedule(boolean)} will be called repeatedly while the trigger is active, and
119   * will be canceled when the trigger becomes inactive.
120   *
121   * @param command the command to start
122   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
123   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
124   */
125  public Trigger whileActiveContinuous(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
126    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "whileActiveContinuous");
127
128    this.ifHigh(() -> command.schedule(interruptible));
129    this.falling().ifHigh(command::cancel);
130
131    return this;
132  }
133
134  /**
135   * Constantly starts the given command while the button is held.
136   *
137   * <p>{@link Command#schedule(boolean)} will be called repeatedly while the trigger is active, and
138   * will be canceled when the trigger becomes inactive.
139   *
140   * @param command the command to start
141   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
142   */
143  public Trigger whileActiveContinuous(final Command command) {
144    return whileActiveContinuous(command, true);
145  }
146
147  /**
148   * Constantly runs the given runnable while the button is held.
149   *
150   * @param toRun the runnable to run
151   * @param requirements the required subsystems
152   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
153   */
154  public Trigger whileActiveContinuous(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
155    return whileActiveContinuous(new InstantCommand(toRun, requirements));
156  }
157
158  /**
159   * Starts the given command when the trigger initially becomes active, and ends it when it becomes
160   * inactive, but does not re-start it in-between.
161   *
162   * @param command the command to start
163   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
164   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
165   */
166  public Trigger whileActiveOnce(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
167    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "whileActiveOnce");
168
169    this.rising().ifHigh(() -> command.schedule(interruptible));
170    this.falling().ifHigh(command::cancel);
171
172    return this;
173  }
174
175  /**
176   * Starts the given command when the trigger initially becomes active, and ends it when it becomes
177   * inactive, but does not re-start it in-between. The command is set to be interruptible.
178   *
179   * @param command the command to start
180   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
181   */
182  public Trigger whileActiveOnce(final Command command) {
183    return whileActiveOnce(command, true);
184  }
185
186  /**
187   * Starts the command when the trigger becomes inactive.
188   *
189   * @param command the command to start
190   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
191   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
192   */
193  public Trigger whenInactive(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
194    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "whenInactive");
195
196    this.falling().ifHigh(() -> command.schedule(interruptible));
197
198    return this;
199  }
200
201  /**
202   * Starts the command when the trigger becomes inactive. The command is set to be interruptible.
203   *
204   * @param command the command to start
205   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
206   */
207  public Trigger whenInactive(final Command command) {
208    return whenInactive(command, true);
209  }
210
211  /**
212   * Runs the given runnable when the trigger becomes inactive.
213   *
214   * @param toRun the runnable to run
215   * @param requirements the required subsystems
216   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
217   */
218  public Trigger whenInactive(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
219    return whenInactive(new InstantCommand(toRun, requirements));
220  }
221
222  /**
223   * Toggles a command when the trigger becomes active.
224   *
225   * @param command the command to toggle
226   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
227   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
228   */
229  public Trigger toggleWhenActive(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
230    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "toggleWhenActive");
231
232    this.rising()
233        .ifHigh(
234            () -> {
235              if (command.isScheduled()) {
236                command.cancel();
237              } else {
238                command.schedule(interruptible);
239              }
240            });
241
242    return this;
243  }
244
245  /**
246   * Toggles a command when the trigger becomes active. The command is set to be interruptible.
247   *
248   * @param command the command to toggle
249   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
250   */
251  public Trigger toggleWhenActive(final Command command) {
252    return toggleWhenActive(command, true);
253  }
254
255  /**
256   * Cancels a command when the trigger becomes active.
257   *
258   * @param command the command to cancel
259   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
260   */
261  public Trigger cancelWhenActive(final Command command) {
262    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "cancelWhenActive");
263
264    this.rising().ifHigh(command::cancel);
265
266    return this;
267  }
268
269  /* ----------- Super method type redeclarations ----------------- */
270
271  @Override
272  public Trigger and(BooleanSupplier trigger) {
273    return cast(super.and(trigger));
274  }
275
276  @Override
277  public Trigger or(BooleanSupplier trigger) {
278    return cast(super.or(trigger));
279  }
280
281  @Override
282  public Trigger negate() {
283    return cast(super.negate());
284  }
285
286  @Override
287  public Trigger debounce(double seconds) {
288    return debounce(seconds, Debouncer.DebounceType.kRising);
289  }
290
291  @Override
292  public Trigger debounce(double seconds, Debouncer.DebounceType type) {
293    return cast(super.debounce(seconds, type));
294  }
295
296  @Override
297  public Trigger rising() {
298    return cast(super.rising());
299  }
300
301  @Override
302  public Trigger falling() {
303    return cast(super.falling());
304  }
305}
